smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams found. All 19 pages contain diagrams with at least one element. Page 1 has packages and actors, pages 2-3 have use cases, page 4 has activity nodes, pages 5-13 have classes, pages 14-19 have database tables.

On page 2 (Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem - Vaata & Tuvasta), all 4 use case ovals (Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet) are connected to actors. On page 3 (Muuda), all 7 use case ovals are associated with Autode haldur and/or Juhataja. Every use case oval has at least 1 actor association.

On page 3 (Autode halduse funktsionaalne allsüsteem - Muuda), two use cases describe the same activity: 'Lisa auto' (Add car) and 'Registreeri auto' (Register car). Both describe introducing/adding a car to the system and both are associated with the same actor 'Autode haldur'. This matches the example in the rule definition ('Add Car', 'Register Car').

On the package overview diagram (page 1), all element names within each package are unique. For example, in 'Klassifikaatorite register': Auto_kategooria, Auto_kategooria_tüüp, Auto_kütuse_liik, Auto_mark, etc. are all distinct names. No duplicate element names found within any single package.

Columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple tables (Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Riik, etc.) but these represent different contextual data (name of role vs. name of category vs. name of country). All shared data between tables (like isik_id, auto_kood) is connected via FK relationships. No true data redundancy without FK relationships found.

All use cases follow consistent verb-first naming pattern. Page 2: Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet. Page 3: Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Lisa auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto. All start with Estonian verbs (Tuvasta=Identify, Vaata=View, Registreeri=Register, Lõpeta=End, Muuda=Change, Lisa=Add, Unusta=Forget).

On page 9 (Auto seisundidiagramm), all 5 states are reachable: Ootel is reachable from initial state Algus; Aktiivne is reachable from Ootel; Unustatud is reachable from Ootel; Mitteaktiivne is reachable from Aktiivne; Lõpetatud is reachable from both Aktiivne and Mitteaktiivne. Every state has at least one incoming transition path.

On page 4 (Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm), all 4 actions are reachable from the start node: 'Vaata kõiki autosid, mida saab lõpetada' directly from Algus; 'Otsi autot' via decision branch; 'Vali auto' via decision branch; 'Lõpeta valitud auto' after Vali auto. Every action can be reached via at least one flow path from start.

All relationships in class diagrams have multiplicity on both ends. Page 5: Töötaja-Auto (1 to 0..*), mentor relationship (0..1 to 0..*). Page 6: Isik-Kasutajakonto (1 to 0..1), Isik-Riik (0..* to 1). Pages 10-13: All associations show multiplicities like 1, 0..*, 0..1. Database diagrams (pages 14-19) all show multiplicity indicators on FK relationships.

Counted central elements per diagram: Page 2: 4 use cases; Page 3: 7 use cases; Page 5: 4 classes (Isik, Töötaja, Auto, Isiku roll); Page 6: 7 classes; Page 7: 6 classes; Page 8: 6 classes; Page 9: 6 states; Page 10: 5 classes; Page 11: 3 classes; Page 12: 7 classes; Page 13: 3 classes; Page 14: 4 tables; Page 15: 9 tables (Tootaja_roll, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_kategooria); Page 16: 3 tables; Page 17: 6 tables; Page 18: 2 tables; Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum count is 9 on page 15. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines on each diagram. Page 17 (Autode register - Klassifikaator): Auto has 4 visible lines (to Auto_mark, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_omamine); Auto_kategooria_omamine has 2 lines. Page 19 (Tootajate register): Tootaja has 4 visible lines (to Isik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, self-reference mentor, Tootaja_rolli_omamine). Maximum connections from any single element is 4. Threshold is ≥6. Since 4 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows related elements are positioned proximally. No relationship distances appear to exceed twice the average distance between elements on any diagram. Elements in database diagrams are arranged in logical groupings with connections between nearby elements.

All use case names start with active verbs: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End/Terminate), Muuda (Change), Lisa (Add), Unusta (Forget). Activity diagram actions on page 4 also start with verbs: Vaata (View), Otsi (Search), Vali (Select), Lõpeta (End). No use cases or actions start with nouns or passive forms.

All class, table, attribute, and use case names have 4 or more characters. Shortest names found: 'Isik' (4 chars), 'Auto' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars), 'kood' (4 chars). Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since minimum name length is 4, which is > 3, smell is NOT present.

All class names start with uppercase and are singular: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Klassifikaator, Töötaja, Klient, Auto, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Riik, etc. No class names start with lowercase or are plural.

All attribute/column names start with lowercase: isik_id, isikukood, riik_kood, e_meil, nimetus, mudel, reg_aeg, synni_kp, auto_kood, on_aktiivne, viimase_muutm_aeg, etc. No attributes or columns start with uppercase letters.

All database table names are singular: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Tootaja, Tootaja_roll, Tootaja_rolli_omamine, Auto, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Auto_kytuse_liik, Riik, Klient, etc. No plural table names found.

No disallowed type prefixes found in class, table, or attribute names. Prefixes like PK_, FK_, pfK_, IXFK_ are present but these are explicitly allowed for primary keys, foreign keys, and indexes. No tbl_, uc_, str, int, or similar type-indicating prefixes found in element names.
